intro: Neoalsomitra muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's neoalsomitra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
